{"step_by_step_thinking": "Scaphocephaly is a type of craniosynostosis, which is a condition where one or more of the fibrous sutures in an infant's skull prematurely fuses. This condition is characterized by a long, narrow head. The sagittal suture, which runs from the front of the head to the back, is the most commonly affected suture in craniosynostosis. When this suture fuses prematurely, it causes scaphocephaly.", "answer_choice": "B. Sagittal suture"}
